concepts.name: Real-world sleep monitoring
concepts.description: Tracking sleep patterns in natural environments rather than controlled laboratories, capturing variability from real-life factors.

concepts.name: Circadian rhythms
concepts.description: Intrinsic 24-hour biological cycles regulating cognitive performance, influencing daily performance fluctuations.

concepts.name: Chronotype
concepts.description: Individual differences in morning/evening preference affecting how circadian rhythms impact performance.

concepts.name: Sleep inertia
concepts.description: Transient cognitive impairment following sleep, modeled as a key factor in performance decline after insufficient sleep.

concepts.name: Homeostatic sleep drive
concepts.description: The physiological need for sleep that accumulates with wakefulness, quantified in the study's statistical model.

concepts.name: Insufficient sleep impact
concepts.description: Performance decrements from inadequate sleep, specifically showing two nights <6 hours of sleep causing 6-day performance decline.

concepts.name: Population-scale physiological sensing
concepts.description: Using large-scale digital interactions (e.g., web searches) to measure physiological states like sleep and performance.

concepts.name: Keystroke speed
concepts.description: Performance metric derived from web interaction speed (typing/clicking), used as a proxy for cognitive function.

concepts.name: Wearable device sleep measures
concepts.description: Objective sleep data (duration, timing) collected via wearables, correlated with performance metrics.

concepts.name: In situ monitoring
concepts.description: Real-time data collection in natural settings, addressing limitations of traditional lab-based sleep studies.

methods.name: Web interaction analysis
methods.description: Using keystroke and click speed from web search engine interactions as a continuous performance metric.

methods.name: Statistical modeling
methods.description: Developing a model integrating circadian rhythms, homeostatic sleep drive, and sleep inertia to predict performance.

methods.name: Wearable device integration
methods.description: Correlating objective sleep data from wearables with web interaction performance metrics across large populations.

methods.name: Population-scale data collection
methods.description: Aggregating 3 million nights of sleep and 75 million interaction tasks from real-world user behavior.

methods.name: Longitudinal correlation
methods.description: Analyzing temporal relationships between prior sleep patterns and subsequent performance over extended periods.
